intro: Silene samojedorum, commonly known as the Siberian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions of Eurasia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cold, temperate climates. It has a short growing season and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Silene samojedorum is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
